workflow-instructions.name: stakeholder-identification
workflow-instructions.overview: Map the ecosystem stakeholders and create initial persona hypotheses. Answers: Who matters most? Who has the primary pain? Who is the buyer vs. the user? Who are the advocates and blockers? Produces the Stakeholder Map and initial Pain Hypothesis.

step.name: stakeholder-brainstorm
step.title: Stakeholder Brainstorm
step.instructions: Map all stakeholder categories in the venture's ecosystem: 1. Who creates the problem / pain? 2. Who experiences the pain most directly? (primary sufferer) 3. Who pays for solutions to the pain? (buyer — may differ from user) 4. Who influences the buying decision? 5. Who would block or resist a new solution? 6. Who would champion a new solution? 7. Who regulates this space? Use the stakeholder-map.md template to organize all stakeholders.

step.name: buyer-user-analysis
step.title: Buyer vs. User Analysis
step.instructions: Determine if buyer and user are the same person: 1. Who uses the solution day-to-day? 2. Who signs the check / approves the budget? 3. If they are different: what does each need to be convinced? 4. Which pain is more acute — the user's operational pain or the buyer's strategic/cost pain? 5. Which stakeholder should the venture prioritize first to get a sale? Note: In B2B, buyer ≠ user is common. This affects the sales motion fundamentally.

step.name: ai-persona-hypotheses
step.title: AI Stakeholder Persona Hypotheses
step.instructions:
Create 2-3 initial persona hypotheses using AI synthesis (NOT real data — clearly labeled): For each persona: - Name / archetype - Role and company context - Day in the life (how they operate) - Primary pain related to the venture domain - How they solve it today (workaround) - What success looks like for them - What would make them change behavior
Label each persona: "⚠️ HYPOTHESIS — AI-synthesized, not based on real interviews. To be validated."

step.name: pain-hypothesis
step.title: Initial Pain Hypothesis
step.instructions: Based on the stakeholder analysis, formulate the initial pain hypothesis: 1. Primary pain hypothesis: who, what pain, when it triggers, what consequence 2. 2-3 secondary pain hypotheses (alternatives to explore) 3. Preliminary FIP estimate for each (Frequency / Intensity / Prevalence) 4. Key assumptions to test in Phase 3 interviews 5. Interview target: who to interview first, how many, what types Use the pain-hypothesis.md template.
step.template-output: Save initial pain hypothesis with assumptions to test.

step.name: stakeholder-map-output
step.title: Produce Stakeholder Map
step.instructions: Compile all stakeholder work into the Stakeholder Map using the stakeholder-map.md template. Fill all sections including the Power/Interest grid. Note which mothership relationships can be leveraged for access. Update venture-state.yaml with completed artifacts and guiding_questions.domain answers.
